SENT.plain: A total of 1,250 selective coronary arteriographic procedures were performed by the percutaneous transfemoral technique
Local complications included delayed hemorrhage in 14 patients, peripheral emboli in 2, and thrombosis in 1
Cerebral complications included fibrin or air emboli in 3 and dislodgement of a mural thrombus by the catheter in 1
Cardiac complications included ventricular fibrillation in 11, myocardial infarction in 3, and profound hypotension in 1
With routine use of a transparent manifold and removal of the guide wire distal to the arch vessels, no cerebral emboli or myocardial infarctions have occurred in the last 500 examinations
